text: Mists from flammable fuels can easily
catch fire here you can see jet fuel
exploding at 1,000 frames per second not
something you want to have happen when
transporting it around long polymer
molecules have been considered as a way
to reduce the risk of fire by
controlling these mists but these
additives can bind up machinery or they
can be damaged as the fuel is pumped now
a new mega super molecule has been
created that does not have these
problems the new molecule is made from
two shorter molecules that strongly
stick together they can break a part of
the pump but come together again
afterwards importantly the pieces
associate end to end not in circles or
flower shapes retaining length and
letting them do their job the same
experiment this time with the polymer
added results in no fire
